byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and SEWELL CHAN

abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron, under fire after Panama Paper revelations about overseas tax havens, engages in increasingly hostile ideological debate with opposition Labour Party in Parliament over right of Britons to accrue wealth; issue has also led British politicians to publicly release information abut their income and tax returns.

headline.print_headline: Mud Is Slung in a Debate on Overseas Tax Havens
headline.main: David Cameron Clashes With Rivals Over Tax Havens and His Wealth

snippet: The British prime minister confronted the Labour Party in Parliament in a spirited debate over economic fairness that was set off by the Panama Papers.
lead_paragraph: The British prime minister confronted the Labour Party in Parliament in a spirited debate over economic fairness that was set off by the Panama Papers.
